intro: Coffea darainensis, commonly known as the Daraina coffee. It is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, native to the highlands of Ethiopia. This plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with dark green, leathery leaves and fragrant white flowers. The fruit, a red, fleshy berry, contains two seeds used for coffee production. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Coffea darainensis is considered a rare and endangered species.
